website_summaries.verdict: If you need a streamlined Leatherman with range of basic tools and few bells and whistles, it has some nice features.
pros: A basic Leatherman with 7 tools that feature multiple pliers and wire cutters
The curved handle is easy to control with a comfortable grip
cons: Lacks the versatility of some competitors
Occasional complaints that blade's serrated edge isn't very effective

customer_reviews.title: Goods and bads
customer_reviews.text: Had this tool for years now. Pros: If you modify the knife (see photo) it's easy to get to and open. If a knife is what you use 90% of the time, check this out. It looks great It's lightweight The caribiner is cool and you can open paint cans with it very well. Bad The pliers will hurt you. Might not be today, might not be tomorrow, but one day you'll be gripping something kinda hard and they'll close real fast. They close tight and the skin on your palm will get caught so hard it will turn into a blood blister. Huge problem in my opinion. USE WITH CAUTION
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: The Skeletool my seem like it has a limited number of tool attached to ...
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased 4 of these at this point and they are by far my most reliable and important EDC item. I feel naked leaving home without it. The Skeletool my seem like it has a limited number of tool attached to it but for normal use what it has covers 90% of what you would need. Its light its functional the blade is accessible without opening the tool (amazing feature). From my personal uses I've yet to break one and I've had to have one not be up to the task at hand. An amazing tool that i cant speak highly enough of. If you in the market for an EDC multi-tool this is my top of the list pick.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Broken within a Month
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product in early April, and it was broken by the first week of May. I was using the blade to fix a wooden kids toy, when the tip completely snapped off. Wasn't applying any undue pressure, just trying to work on a simple piece of wood and the blade snaps. This was either a dud or leatherman quality has severely fallen off. Now I'm out the shipping costs to send it back to leatherman for repairs. Not exactly how one expects the first month with a multitool to be spent...in the repair shop.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Beagle

customer_reviews.title: Broken Blade
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I’m pretty disappointed in the quality of this tool. I’ve used it nearly everyday for a year and although I did really enjoy it, the blade broke on me the other day. Doing what? Cutting plastic... Thin plastic that a drill bit set came in. For a nearly $50 knife I would have expected a long life without issues. Never had any problems with a Gerber or SOG Guess we’ll see if Leatherman stands behind it as I don’t foresee Amazon and/or the seller taking responsibility.
customer_reviews.author: Josh T. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Comparison: Skeletool standard vs. CX model
customer_reviews.text: I have the. For those curious of the comparisons, here's a simple breakdown: This model: cheaper - almost half the price different material for knife blade - high quality, but just not as high as that in the CX model knife blade has a serrated back half CX: more expensive has carbon fiber in handle - but only a very tiny amount, doesn't affect weight (see photo), really just for looks knife blade is of a higher quality steel - they're both good, just different - my guess is this is where extra cost comes in (?) knife blade has no serrations
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: I've done a 180
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Skeletool in December of 2018, carried it daily for 6 weeks, and decided I didn't like it. I was fine with the tool set, but it just wasn't very comfortable to handle -- many edges and hot spots. I held onto it anyway but switched to a Wingman for my EDC. With warmer weather came lighter clothing (shorts), and I find that the 5 oz Skeletool carries very well. I also carry a Micra on my keychain, which gives me scissors, a small file, and a small flathead screwdriver. Interestingly, I don't have the same problem with handling comfort that I had before. The Skeletool is back in rotation as my summer EDC tool.
customer_reviews.author: Garockey

customer_reviews.title: Knife tip broke after 13 months
customer_reviews.text: So sad. My BF loved this tool. He is a huge fan of Leatherman overall and was so excited when I got this for him last year. He came home last night and said he was using it at work to open a box and the tip of the knife just cracked off. I got the pocket knife at the same time so I'm going to try to swap them (if I can find a bit that fits to unscrew them). Hopefully that knife won't suffer the same fate. Before this happened he always had this on him and there were many an Amazon Delivery box cut open by it.
customer_reviews.author: K.C.

customer_reviews.title: Message of caution when buying and using this tool.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd Leatherman multi-tool. I love the brand and was excited to buy this multi- tool. The biggest and most glaring issue I have with the tool is that the liner locking mechanism does not hold up under pressure. I was using the knife and put pressure on the non-blade side and it snapped back and sliced my finger. I haven't used it since. Again I have to say that my overall experience with Leatherman products has been four and five stars. But I was really excited about the features and the functionality of this multi-tool and it let me down.
customer_reviews.author: Walter

customer_reviews.title: I Love the Skeletool
customer_reviews.text: The Leatherman Skeleltool is such an amazing EDC. The blade is way better than most multitool blades (although I wish they made a non-serrated version at this price without the 154cm blade). The pliers are not spring-assisted, but I find them quite sturdy and they come in handy so often. The bottle opener is a bit weird, but it works well once you get used to it. The screwdriver comes in handy all the time and you can get a set of many different bits for the Skeletool. Overall it is constantly finding its way into my pocket and I can't wait to upgrade to the more premium Skeletool CX when I have the money.
customer_reviews.author: Xander Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Short-lived
customer_reviews.text: I had mine fall apart within 60 days of purchase. I had a similar gerber that I used for 3 years without issue.. I'm literally going back to my gerber as a backup while I get this replaced. Return service expects me to pay shipping, which seems kind of silly.. Lifetime warranty.. Sure.. But I can't mail this thing back every 2 months. We'll see if leatherman 2 does any better. To add to it, the knife popped out and just about stabbed me as I was putting quite a bit of forward force on it to screw in some plastic screws.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I normally carry a flashlight and knife in my pocket when I am doing maintenance and hvac work. I really needed plyers and cutters but didn't want a full multitool with all the wasted tools I'd never use weighing me down. This works perfectly for me and fits well in my pocket. I use the flat screwdriver as a prybar/scraper and never feel like I am going to break it. Plyers get used everyday and the knife is sharp and locks in tight. When I get home from work I use the bottle opener to crack open a beer. Only thing I don't like is the screwdriver will dig into your hand from time to time especially when opening it.
customer_reviews.author: Faids

customer_reviews.title: Decent. But not for me.
customer_reviews.text: Blade broke after a week. Was just trying to whittle some stock down. Lost the bit after another week, then lost the tool the next year. Was it decent? Yea. Would I get it again or reccomend it? Nah. Multi tools arent bad, they just arent great at any one thing. I think this one came in handy once when I needed a bottle opener for a beer. Other than that I would just get full size tools instead of using this. The one time I decided to do anything serious (yea whittling is serious bidniss) the blade broke.
customer_reviews.author: DirtyMeatSack

customer_reviews.title: Cant live with out mine!
customer_reviews.text: An every day carry (EDC) knife/multi tool is a very personal decision. It has to feel right and fit right and give you all the functionality you want and none that you don't. Leatherman is the gold standard in quality and design as far as I'm concerned. My skeletool goes with me everywhere and get used daily. The knife opens with the flick of a thumb and closes very easily. The other tools are tucked away nicely and it feels "everlasting" in your hand. The blade is of exceptional quality and takes sharpening well.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Goldsmith

customer_reviews.title: Light, portable, and good gear for motorcycle riders
customer_reviews.text: Super portable, and fits in my handle well. I am using it for my motorcycle rides in case there are small items that I need to fix, and also been using it daily for the past week on opening boxes and using the pliers for small fixes around the house. Still holds well after a few weeks of use. It took a while to learn how to change the drill bit, but after I figured it out it was good. I like the clip feature and also how light it is. I purchased it with a gift card and discount for around $40, so, it was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: adoptme

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several of these over the years. One fell out of my pocket on a whitewater river trip. Another disappeared on a cabling project for work. I purchased this with the extra bit set this time and love it! The versatility of opening the knife with one hand to quickly cut open a box, interchangeable screwdriver bits to work on a server rack mount or sturdy pliers to cut wire and bend it for changing out an electric plug. I have used it for that and more this week. It is as important as my cell phone! I am seriously thinking of buying another to keep in my laptop bag, just in case!
customer_reviews.author: Richard B

customer_reviews.title: Leatherman make a fine product
customer_reviews.text: I've owned and used this very same tool in work for several years. I ask a lot from it. I have broken two of these because the needle nose pliers really cant handle sideways torque. Leatherman replaced the tools without hassle. I recently misplaced the tool while in work and promptly bought a replacement the same day. I was surprise to see that they have added a snap to the case flap. This was the only part of the tool I didn't like as the case flap for the one I use every day the old velcro flap had lost its hold power. Can't recommend enough.
customer_reviews.author: ibowhunt

customer_reviews.title: Not serrated as pictured
customer_reviews.text: Is not as pictured. Has a straight blade. No serrated edge as pictured. Should definitely be pictured that way. The other 3 ive bought have all be as pictured
customer_reviews.author: brian J

customer_reviews.title: Replaced other multitools.
customer_reviews.text: In my EDC thanks to this multitool I have been able to cut weight. This has become my number one tool throughout the day whenever I need something. While I wouldn't rebuild a car, even a pugot with it, I do use it to take care of a lot of little chores and it keeps working. The lock on the knife blade is easy to use and can be manipulated right or left handed. It weighs far less than other tools, and for me it's what I want without what I don't use. Good for an urban setting.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Fan-Tastic Product
customer_reviews.text: I was gifted one of these several years ago. I fell in love with it overnight. It has been my EDC for several years. Small in size so that I forget it's in my pocket but, big on usability. I decided I wanted this one with the partial serrated edge. I gave my old one to my son and now carty this one. I'm a big BUCK knives fan and have always used/carried a BUCK Multitool. But, this Leatherman Skeletool changed everything.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: A pared down, lightweight Leatherman
customer_reviews.text: It’s a nice and simple knife, not overloaded with stuff. Pliers are good. Kinda wish that they were replaceable like some of the other Leatherman knives. I’m surprised to find that I’m actually using the screw driver. With four heads it’s pretty versatile. The bottle opener is fun. Way cooler than I thought it would be. The little clasp that goes over the bottle opener isn’t quite as sturdy as I was hoping. A friend popped it off on accident trying to open a bottle (the wrong way). Once I found it, it was easy to put it back on. Overall, I like the simplicity.
customer_reviews.author: Snoopy

customer_reviews.title: Great small multi tool. Happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Great lightweight tool. Knife blade is big enough be carried without a 2nd knife, unless you just want a larger blade. Philips head works well (some of the tools I've seen have heads that are mostly flat and entirely worthless...Looking you Gerber Crucial and Suspension). Light, slender, fits easily in the coin pocket of jeans next to a small light. Pliers have worked well for me. I live in a dry environment, but have not noticed any corrosion. Carabiner clip is also the bottle opener. Opener works well, hasn't seemed to damage the carabiner clip using it.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Schmon

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, fits great, not durable
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well, great size and usefulness for something that can be carried like a regular pocket knife, but i bought this one in Feb and a jaw broke off in april. Previously I had the carbon one that lasted through over 4 years of daily use. Not sure if the metallurgy changed, but i can not recommend this if you need it to be more than an occasional use tool.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Caudill

customer_reviews.title: IT Persons dream pocket knife and tool.
customer_reviews.text: I am a IT Guy and there are 4 things I always need. Knife, screwdriver (standard and phillips), pliers and wire cutters. This has all four with a bonus bottle opener. Pocket clip is positioned perfectly. But the best part is the knife can be extended with one hand without opening up the tool! Knife even has a safety lock. Well done, Leatherman! Can you make it in safety orange and I will but another.
customer_reviews.author: OTazMan

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome pocket tool
customer_reviews.text: I love it. While not a versatile as some of the other, larger Leatherman tools, it's much more compact. Easy to clip onto a belt, or edge of your pocket, and I love the exchangeable bits on the driver. It's not a total Macguyver-tool, nor is it intended to be, but it has replaced my Leathermen 200 and Wave as a daily accessory. I would not count on it as my one-and-only survival tool, but as a daily-use tool, it has not let me down. Funny how my friends think I'm dorky for always sporting a multi-tool, but they never hesitate to ask to borrow it constantly. I guess I'm a terminal scout.
customer_reviews.author: s. taylor

customer_reviews.title: perfect for IT support
customer_reviews.text: TL;DR, the perfect lightweight multitool for a tech support person. I'm a support technician for a corporation and this is literally perfect for my everyday needs. i commonly have to open up pc's and replace components, and this phillips is great for that. The pliers are good enough for what i use them for, but i would never apply a lot of force to these.. theyre pretty skinny. Theyre also impossible to open one handed. The knife is my most used tool, and its great. Its small (i hate carrying a large blade, theyre usually a pain to use to open packages, cut cables, etc), easy to open, and very sharp!
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Duappointing, buy a different model.
customer_reviews.text: It seems below-average build quality for leatherman. The pliers flex a lot during normal use, and they do not fit the hand well at all. The screwdriver is great, and has a sprung latch to retain the bits. The pocket clip is crappy and unrefined with sharp edges. It sits awkwardly to the side in the pocket. The blue finish scratches easily. I wish there were a few more tools for the price. Not what I expect from leatherman.
customer_reviews.author: Nick P

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good tool for the price
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good tool for the price. Wish it had a couple more tools, like tweezers and the can opener and I wish the drivers were fold away instead of being detachable. The button to release the screw driver is in an unfortunate spot, so the driver comes out when you squeeze the Leatherman together. So far it's dropped out of the tool half a dozen times in a couple weeks. It's just a matter of time before it's lost. Update: driver is now lost due to Leatherman's poor design.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Good light-duty multi-tool
customer_reviews.text: It's a great low work-load multi-tool. I wouldn't use this for anything more than light-duty repair -- it just doesn't have the grunt and strength of the thicker/stronger tools like the Leatherman Wave. An example of how I would use this is to take off panels for controllers, cleaning out nooks and crannies of dirty solenoid valves, checking small electro-mechanical devices like sensors, and using it for small work-load scenarios. Definitely wouldn't not latch this into a rusted bolt or use it to pry off a stuck piston rod plunger or anything that requires you use more muscle.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb McDowell

customer_reviews.title: Awesome EDC item and valuable gift
customer_reviews.text: I’ve carried one of these for a few years now and have given several as gifts. Back in the market because I’ve lost mine. I’ve used this for everything from IT to bulldozer work and everything in between. It doesn’t replace a tool box or even a “real” leatherman, but for the weight of a pocket knife it has saved me 100s of trips to get the right tools for a simple quick fix. You do need to realize it’s limitations, if you’re the kind of person that uses a pocket knife for a crowbar you’re probably going to break this too. I suggest ordering 2 so you have a backup ready to go in case you misplace the first.
customer_reviews.author: Hawk

customer_reviews.title: Love the look of this!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our son for Christmas, and I am sure he is going to love it!! I am a Leatherman fan from way back, still have my original one. After seeing and handling this one, I may have to drop hints for a future gift for me to the family. I like the removable belt clip, this way it can be worn on the belt or carried in your pocket. Another plus is that it's stainless steel, so this tool will never rust or corrode.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Roth

customer_reviews.title: Did I get a used one?
customer_reviews.text: I really like the design of this, not as bulky as the other Leatherman and not as expensive. However I’m not sure if it’s from Leatherman or from amazon but the one I received seemed not entirely brand new, there is some kind of gunk in the pliers and obviously some kind of fouling on the blade. Lots of loose metal shavings still hanging out around all over the tool, maybe this tool is cheaper because they take short cuts producing it, who knows. Two stars for first impression, I’ll be carrying it around for the next couple weeks maybe I’ll update and raise the rating if it blows me away I’m performance.
customer_reviews.author: Tony N.

customer_reviews.title: Bought it for my husband and he loves it
customer_reviews.text: My husband wanted a simple tool to use when fishing and this fit the bill perfectly. This is probably the 4th leatherman tool he owns. He keeps one in his work truck, private truck, at home and now for fishing. I highly recommend it. It is a quality item and lasts a long time. Will buy another one when he asks for it. As a side note, I’d love it if they made some geared for women instead of just a pink shirt with their name on it. We use them too you know!
customer_reviews.author: Kato

customer_reviews.title: Great knife, all of my co-workers have owned a Leatherman for years
customer_reviews.text: All of my co-workers own a Leatherman of some sort, many of them opting for the more expensive models, and I decided to give them a try after losing my pocket knife, somehow. This knife is SHARP straight from the factory, significantly sharper than my previous pocket knife, and with a much thinner blade than my EDC car knife. The pliers are stiff and a bit hard to use, but they have already come in handy, and the phillips+flat screwdrivers are also helpful. A really great product that should last for years, well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Carringer

customer_reviews.title: Has everything you need, nothing you don't
customer_reviews.text: The first truly EVERY day carry tool. Slim enough to not be obtrusive, sturdy enough to do everything you want. Not extra stuff that you never use. Very well thought out and easy to access. Plus you don't feel like you're going to slice your fingers off putting the blade away. I've purchased one for all my close friends. It's perfect!
customer_reviews.author: The Parrothead

customer_reviews.title: The tips for Phillips/ flat head fall out of the attachment where they can be used pretty easily my Phillips is already missing
customer_reviews.text: This tool is ok for a pocket stored tool. The knife is very thin, my tip is already obliterated with very light use. The tips for Phillips/ flat head fall out of the attachment where they can be used pretty easily my Phillips is already missing. For the price a cheaper more expandable tool is recommended, or get the larger leatherman at double the cost. Really don't see any real benefit there are comparable brands out there with same materials for much less cost.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley A.

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional EDC tool!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a couple of these recently to give as gifts. They have just the right set of features to be a great EDC for the average person. Everything you need, nothing you don't. I knocked a point off because they're not exactly comfortable, but they're comfortable enough to get the job done. I will definitely continue buying these as the younger generation in my family become old enough to carry a multi tool!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Palkovic

customer_reviews.title: Love it but I wish it was spring loaded
customer_reviews.text: I love Leatherman tools, including this little multitool. I ended up swapping a straight edge blade from Leatherman Skeletool kb over to my pliers and now I have a pliers with straight edge and a pocket knife with half serrated blade, all for the price of Skeletool cx. Only thing I do not like about this pliers is that it's not spring loaded.
customer_reviews.author: Tornike Gigolashvili

customer_reviews.title: Exactly the muli tool I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I am a maintenance technician and I wanted something that would always be at my side. I've purchased multi tools that needed to be loaded onto my belt. The problem was that I would be fully dressed before realizing I still didn't have the multi tool on me. This tool has solved that problem. It can hang on a sturdy beltloop. Barring that, there is a handy side clip that keeps this Leatherman tool at the top of a pocket. I can recommend the Leatherman tool and the seller for prompt shipping.
customer_reviews.author: David Camp

customer_reviews.title: Knife cut me while using pliers
customer_reviews.text: This tool has just the features I want. Less is more. The tool is still tight and a little difficult to open the pliers but will get better with time. BUT... While using the pliers, somewhat aggressively, trying to extract a stubborn bolt, the knife blade inadvertently partly deployed. As I was working the bolt the tip of the knife was digging into my fingers. Because it is so sharp I didn't notice until saw the blood dripping. I received a significant laceration across the side of my ring finger as well as a couple of poke marks in my middle finger. I still use the tool but I am very careful now.
customer_reviews.author: Naitramde

customer_reviews.title: light tough just enough tools on it!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! I have two or three Waves in different bags/vehicles and they really rock especially for heavier/ tough jobs but are therefore a little heavy in your pocket w out the belt sheath. This is a lighter duty version w my most commonly used tools on it and has a durable pocket clip!! No sheath needed. Clip it and forget it! Love this thing. Probably will get a second and more to give as gifts. Not advised for super heavy duty work but for ~90+% of regular needs it's a real keeper imho.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for all men (and women) who really have no use for such devices
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for Father’s Day for my husband. He is not a guy that would walk around the world using this and being a typical handy guy with it. He’s more of a fidgeter. And I got tired of him fidgeting with magnetized marbles and dropping them in the car and around the house only to find little metal balls clinging to things everywhere while we clean. So this has been a great alternative fidgeting device for my not so manly man.
customer_reviews.author: Els

customer_reviews.title: Love this knife
customer_reviews.text: This has become my every day carry. I own multiple more expensive knifes like spyderco para 3 and such, but have switched to carrying this due to it being multi-functioning. I do wish they would come out with a S35VN model, but the heat treat on the blade must be pretty good because it has stayed sharp for a while now.
customer_reviews.author: heath harris

customer_reviews.title: Quality tool but late delivery.
customer_reviews.text: Well made tool. Price is high at 59.00 a good value at the old price of $34.95 It arrived late even after several phone/chat contacts with Amazon. It’s small, too expensive for it’s size, there are better options for the money. All Amazon “Logistics” Dept. did was appologize......
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This thing is perfect I put it on my belt loop and I ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this for work, it's my first Leatherman. I didn't want something with a bunch of tools I'm not going to use, which makes it too big for its purpose. This thing is perfect I put it on my belt loop and I got my knife, pliers, and screwdrivers, basically stuff that I would need to instantly have on me at any given time (maintenance at a injection shop). And being a leatherman even if I ever do break it they replace it for 25 years no question. So you really can't go wrong it. Feels solid and it's an awesome tool. Five stars! Thank you Leatherman!
customer_reviews.author: T.J. Goode

customer_reviews.title: works great but....
customer_reviews.text: this is a high quality tool that has done everything I needed. it is a small thin design that fits well in a pocket. my only gripe is that while the driver bits LOOK like normal bits that can use standard bits they are NOT. they seem like they put them in a vise and smashed them to 1/2 the width ergo the receiver for them only works with their proprietary bits. its a draw back I did not see from the pics and not a question you have until you know. that sait I still carry it and am pleased with it over all.
customer_reviews.author: snarfzilla

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Comfortable, Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Very strong, comfortable and very easy to use. I work in a refinery and literally use my leatherman everyday. It is very practical, very easy to use, and fits very comfortably in your hand. Each tool it comes with is easy to reach. I utilize the Case that comes with the knife to keep it in better condition, but it isn’t necessary because it comes with a pocket clip as well as a belt loop clip for easy attachment to your pants or utility belt of some kind. Worth the money and worth the review.
customer_reviews.author: Jtwedt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome design low quality materials
customer_reviews.text: I loved this tool while it lasted. Both the knife and pliers boke on me while using them on what i would call medium duty task. Like bending wire on a silt fence thing i have done over and over again with my cheap husky multi-tool that cost and 5th of the price with no problem. The design is awesome though Being able to clip it to my belt loop give me piece of mind that i wont lose it. If you have the extra 20 go with the one that is madr of higher quality materials.
customer_reviews.author: R. Armendariz

customer_reviews.title: Great tool and solid materials used to make it
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few other multi-tools, but never a Leatherman, primarily due to cost. You definitely get what you pay for here, and I regret only having not bought one sooner. The craftsmanship of the tool is fantastic and it has all the things I would ever need, from the drill bits to the knife and pliers. I didn't even see it had a bottle opener until I got it in hand, but that's awesome too (one less thing to carry!). If this goes on sale/reduced price, don't hesitate, buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Murphy

customer_reviews.title: My every day go to multitool. Even though it ...
customer_reviews.text: My every day go to multitool. Even though it has fewer tools than my other gerbers and sogs, I keep turning to this one to bring with me. The pliers are solid, the blade stays sharp and the actions on all parts are smooth, while also being much lighter and sleeker than similar sized multitools. Bare essential tool selection but all the things you need most in a value priced, lighter, easier to carry package.
customer_reviews.author: mr. e

customer_reviews.title: My favorite EDC tool
customer_reviews.text: This is very lightweight, sturdy and reliable multitool. Use it as my EDC tool and very happy with it. It contains almost all tools that you may need in everyday routine. Not the fancy extra-multi-space tool, but a definitely solid one. Skeleton look is very attractive though.
customer_reviews.author: Vsevolod S.

customer_reviews.title: Knife good, pocket clip bad
customer_reviews.text: It's a Leatherman lite basically. It's nice having pliers, screw drivers, and a knife all in one. Bought this since it had a pocket clip, the pocket clip does not hold it securely in a pocket. I have tried Jean's, khakis, to just about everything I own. I now carry it in the sheath, it's still lighter than the Wave but wish it could be carried in a pocket via the clip.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D.

customer_reviews.title: Very cool piece if gear
customer_reviews.text: Very cool piece if gear. I was expecting the screw driver inserts to fall out, but they are very secure so no issue there. Pros: has nearly everything you'll need. The clip is nice if you plan on using it. Doesn't hurt your hand like the old style leatherman. Cons: the clip is bulky if you don't plan on using it. Heavy, depending on what you're doing this may not be a concern. Can't take on an airplane (though this is more of a TSA issue and not a knife issue.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Skeletool Multitool
customer_reviews.text: So, this could be an every day carry. Slim enough to be carried on body all day. It's my backup that lives in my EDC kit getting used frequently. Sturdy design. Love the placement of the blade with it being accessed one handed, rare for a multi-tool. Also purchased the additional bits and rely solely on this for daily tasks. Great work Leatherman.
customer_reviews.author: Stuck-N-CA

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic tool. I've had mine for over 3 years ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic tool. I've had mine for over 3 years now and it works as new, blade is a little chipped and dull but it's just as functional. I've never lost any bits, they've never come loose. I've taken this tool to 3 continents, from coast to jungle to snow covered mountain. When it breaks ill buy another one. But if i knew it would last this long I'd probably get the carbon fiber version.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Ringmeier

customer_reviews.title: I guess good tool -- terrible instructions
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to understand. Instructions showed entire product line in See Spot Run graphics on a single-pamphlet sheet of paper and lazy authoring made it necessary to waste time and hunt around on YouTube for users' free tutorials/info (which should have been included by the manufacturer) as to how to operate, use, and understand how the different tools are manipulated on the knife.
customer_reviews.author: pal2tech

customer_reviews.title: Great basic pocket tool needs some improvements.
customer_reviews.text: I love this as an everyday use pocket knife and tool kit. It's small and compact makes it comfortable in the hand. As it is leather man the quality is there as well. This multi-tool comes outbid the box sleek and well made. I love this tool. However, I wish that leatherman could blend this and the OHT together into one tool. Then I would be In Heaven. *Improvements on this: 1)needs to have spring loaded pliers 2) bottle opener needs some trial and error so it is more effective. 3) needs a straight blade and a separate serrated blade, as well as spring scissors.
customer_reviews.author: Ted V.

customer_reviews.title: Broke first time I used it
customer_reviews.text: First time I used it the pliers broke. I was not even doing anything really hard with it. I am doing an exchange for a new one hoping I just got a bad one that had a flaw. If that one breaks I will just plain return it. I have had a cheaper version, off-brand, and the only thing that broke on that was the clip. I am very disappointed, I was hoping by getting a higher end brand I would have less worry about it breaking. Not happy but hopeful for the replacement to be of better quality. I will use that one right away to make sure it does not have any flaws as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My go-to tool for minor tasks
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the more inexpensive leathermans, but it's still got their famous quality. Has most of the tools you need around the house for minor things (screwdriver, pliers, snippers, knife, bottle opener). I carry this everywhere, it's super useful.
customer_reviews.author: Alex S.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I am a custodian and i use this tool frequently at work not only to cut things, but to scrap unidentified substances off things, the knife's edge has held up surprisingly well and the carabiner is very useful for keeping it on a belt loop. The black finish on the screwdriver tip came off the tip after just a little bit of use, but the bit itself is not worn down.
customer_reviews.author: N/A

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool with Slim Profile
customer_reviews.text: Excellent slim multi-tool with neat ergonomics (note the curved hand grip) - and it manages to give you two sizes each of Philips and Flathead screwdriver heads. I had to search the Internet on how to close the blade, the release knob/lever is not clearly marked.
customer_reviews.author: Unregistered Guest

customer_reviews.title: Good tool to carry on you at all times.
customer_reviews.text: This tool has been more helpful. While it doesnt have as many gadgets as other multi tools it is a great one and serves its purpose. It is strong not at all flimsy like some. I always carry it on me and until this never carried one. I manage to use it daily.
customer_reviews.author: Javier

customer_reviews.title: Love this for my EDC
customer_reviews.text: I love leatherman products!! I got this tool 2 years ago and snapped a plier claw off. They had me send it in and sent me a new one. Since then this one has lasted nearly 2 years of everyday carry and use. I don’t walk out of the door without it. Every man needs one! The screwdrivers really come in handy! And the bottle opener if you wanna crack a cold one with da boys.
customer_reviews.author: STARKENBURG COMPANY

customer_reviews.title: A beautiful tool that can perform!
customer_reviews.text: Looked at several multi tools, I love how the skeletool looks, I use it almost everyday. Its a bit big for EDC so I will probably buy a gerber dime or something similar but I also may buy a readyman belt holder and put this in it and that would make it EDC ready. I love my skeletool and my girlfriend even ask me where it is all the time to she can use it!
customer_reviews.author: Paulo Matias

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended, sturdy with a sharp blade
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for my husband, who absolutely loves it. He takes it with him to work every day hooked to his belt loops. The hook itself is sturdy and feels very reliable. I keep stealing it from him to use the pliers, or the knife, so I suspect that I am going to have to order some for myself shortly. In addition, the knife is very sharp. I am very impressed with it. The blades that come on most multitools are dull and near useless, but this one has cut through all of the plastic and packaging we have thrown at it.
customer_reviews.author: RaMa

customer_reviews.title: I am a repeat customer
customer_reviews.text: I had my last one for 3 years until it fell to the bottom of a 30 foot reservoir. Rocky bottom made recover impossible. It was a no brainer to buy another. It's my everyday carry tool, and I use it every day. You will love it!
customer_reviews.author: mama lion

customer_reviews.title: Leatherman Skeletool
customer_reviews.text: I have carried this tool for about two years now and it is a fantastic useful tool. I use the knife all the time and the cutter/plier tool frequently as well. I used to carry one of the Gerber and Leatherman multi-tool but once I found this tool I was hooked. I highly recommend this tool for anyone who needs a knife, pliers and screw driver. Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: John L. Gudavich

customer_reviews.title: Great for every day carry. I carry one with me everywhere and can't suggest them enough.
customer_reviews.text: The skeletool has been great. I typically find myself using this every day for various things in life. I don't see this as something a tradesman would use in and out, as it is not meant to be a real workhorse. This is one of those tools that is good at a ton of things, but great at none. I have used the skeletool for everything from opening boxes and beers, to assembling furniture, to pulling apart a computer in the field. It has just enough of everything to get most jobs done you'll encounter day to day. Everyone should have one, but beware as they are very sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Brian McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Great multi tool
customer_reviews.text: I have beat this thing for over a year and use it almost daily. It’s a great setup. My only complaint is the second bit always falls out. I feel like it would stay in better if it was on the other side.
customer_reviews.author: Alex / Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Amazing everyday carry for those odds and ends!
customer_reviews.text: Not a full size leatherman but is much easier to carry and fit in pocket instead of on belt. I carry this thing everywhere with the pocket clip and absolutely love it. I have had it only for a couple weeks and have used every tool available on this thing. It has 4 different bit heads and they work great. Turn the handles to make an L shape and you can get tons of leverage.
customer_reviews.author: travis

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I've lost it twice, and both times, immediately bought a replacement. It's a multitool with the form factor of a regular pocket-clip pocket knife. I can't tell you how often I pull this out at work for those times when I just need a quick screwdriver/pliers/knife. I used to have the version without the carabiner or screwdriver, but this fullsize skeletool is much better, and I don't notice the additional length of the carabiner in my pocket at all.
customer_reviews.author: Matt K.Top Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: It cuts a wicked path...
customer_reviews.text: He loves it. He really loves it. We have been through many different Leatherman tools over the years, but somehow this Skeletool has risen to the top of the bottle. Cream of the crop! In true Leatherman fashion, this tool opens and closes with ease. It hooks onto a belt. It remains securely closed. Blades are sharp. Tools are varied and fulfill so many different tasks. What makes this special? For me - the visual is A Plus. I love the design - the holes, the cutaways. It feels good in the hand and is pleasing to the senses. And it cuts a mean rope. 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: jgr2

customer_reviews.title: ALMOST the best edc tool EVER!!!
customer_reviews.text: The Skeletool is one of the greatest pocket edc tools on the market today... So why did I give it 4 stars? Because it has a few features that could be improved? NO! Because the skeletool cx exists, and it really is worth the extra $, and it gets 5 stars! But! If your like me and need something cheap now, the skeletool is an AWESOME choice, because you can upgrade it in the future to be just as good as the cx! I loved this multitool so much that I not only carry it every day, but I also did a YouTube review on it, check it out! [...]
customer_reviews.author: Jacob B. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: This is the best multi tool available
customer_reviews.text: This is the best multi tool available, purchased one for each of my Ranch workers, They carry them everywhere they go and I smile as I see them pull them out and use them daily. The guarantee is the best, several times they have broken an item on the multi-tool and I have returned them to Leatherman and they have been repaired and returned at no cost. Simply the best basic tool with no extras to take up spacer and add weight.
customer_reviews.author: David Hunsicker

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one (first one got left on a job somewhere, but lasted 2 years of regular abuse). Take a lot of abuse, and I'm surprised how much you can do with such a small light tool. Materials are top notch and the knife is SHARP!
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: I love this leatherman so much
customer_reviews.text: I love this leatherman so much. I lost my old one and had to order a new right away. I keep it on my key chain (it is a bit heavy for a key chain) so i can easily get to it. I use it a couple times a day, it can be very handy. Couple downsides: -the pliers are a bit hard to move, and not spring loaded like other models - The screw drive bits can be bent easier than I would like. I tight screw and bent them. but you can buy spares so that helps
customer_reviews.author: DTT San Diego

customer_reviews.title: IMHO: BEST EVERY DAY CARRY (EDC)
customer_reviews.text: I have carried this knife on my person every day since i bought it, years ago. I have purchased two more for my dad and my mom's husband. Has everything you need frequently in a stylish lightweight package. People who like multi tools complement me on it constantly. The CX version is worth taking a look at because of the better blade.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits my needs, yours may vary.
customer_reviews.text: Limited number of tools included, but that's kind of the point. Has everything I usually need, and nothing I don't. Also very easy to carry, can either use the belt clip for belt or pocket, or use the carabineer clip to attach it to a belt loop or other loop.
customer_reviews.author: TheTodd1981

customer_reviews.title: Used it 3 times the plier jaw broke on cutting ...
customer_reviews.text: Used it 3 times the plier jaw broke on cutting coat hanger. I have owned 4 leathermans that held up lost the last one I had for 7 years.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley Eschker

customer_reviews.title: The Signal is Better
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after I lost my Leatherman Signal. I have had it for a month I use it daily< I would say I am not super happy with it and wish I just bought another SIgnal. The Skeletool is essentially a lower end version of that tool. So far two things have happened that make me aware of the lower quality of this tool including that the pliers have become offset, and that the screww connecting the clip has loosened to wear I need to keep tightening it in order to keep it from falling off. Like I said before just get the SIgnal.
customer_reviews.author: Micah Burkey

customer_reviews.title: not a very multi multi tool
customer_reviews.text: This tool doesn't do much and is not as compact as it could be. Its not that comfortable to use and suffers from the USUAL leatherman tool problem of having weak pliers that will break 'i guarantee it!' If twisting to higher gauge wire that even cheap pliers could have handled. The Wave type tools have by far the best design. The skeletool most certainly does not. My advice is that the cheapest DECENT leatherman you could possibly buy is the Wave. Its not worth it really for the price hike up to the even better Charge series. The Surge is also excellent but very heavy.
customer_reviews.author: M. marsden

customer_reviews.title: Cheap construction.
customer_reviews.text: Broke, then the replacement broke. Both times it was the same spot at the pliers. Its just a cheap pot metal that keeps no strength. Its fine if you don't use a multi-tool except in a backpack as an emergency but if you use one semi daily this isnt for you.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, best Leatherman I've ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: I love my new Skeletool, it only lacks scissors to be the ultimate EDC pocket tool, IMO. I fixed that by purchasing a Leatherman Style CS keychain tool which provides a good sized pair of scissors that clips on my keychain!
customer_reviews.author: Jay Cook

customer_reviews.title: False Advertising
customer_reviews.text: The description of the item is shown as "Columbia Blue". When it arrived, the color is no where near the blue shown on Amazon's website. The color written on the package indicates it is "Denim Blue", a blue-gray color. If you're going to sell something, make sure your description and product match. The only reason I decided to keep the item is because my husband said he wanted to keep it. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle G.

customer_reviews.title: Blade Cracked Across Base
customer_reviews.text: Really liked the multi tool. I had no complaints and then the knife blade cracked across the base after only 9 months of light use. I have had no problem with my other Leatherman tools. Not sure if this is a design flaw or just a fluke. Either way... I expected better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Hazy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for EDC
customer_reviews.text: Now that I have been carrying the Skeletool daily for a while, I can that it is just what I was looking for: a lightweight, easy-to-use, versatile multitool. I use the knife blade every day, and the fact that I can easily open the knife one-handed and equally easily close it one-handed makes it ideal. Add to this the pliers/wirecutter and screwdriver, and you have the core of a highly functional tool for everyday use. The Skeletool replaces the Swiss Army knife that I've carried every day for the past 30+ years and which I will always treasure. The only important thing that the Skeletool lacks is a corkscrew!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Best pocket knife ever
customer_reviews.text: 6-stars. My absolute favorite pocket knife I have ever carried in my life. I have dozens and dozens of knives and have carried almost every kind in my picket over the past 25 years. This is by far the best and most useful knife without having to carry a full-size leatherman. Well done.
customer_reviews.author: Esquire

customer_reviews.title: Quality Control issues with item received.
customer_reviews.text: Item received was either a factory second or used. Had scratches and dings when it was received. The plier were very hard to unfold/fold and open and close. I have not had any issues with any other leatherman products I own. It came in an unsealed box in a plastic bag not in a sealed package like you would receive from a retail store. It says it came from net rush and they are an authorized dealer so I do not think it is a counterfeit. I am disappointed I have to return it as it was a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lightweight tool; weak jaws
customer_reviews.text: Love this tool and have carried it daily for about 7 years. They have weak jaws if you twist--I've broken many of them, but they are intended to be lightweight so shame on me. Have also snapped some blades (but I've abused them). I also frequently catch the clip on my seat belt and bend it wide open. Leatherman has replaced at least 6 of these tools for me with refurbished ones. 4 stars because of the fragile jaws, otherwise I love it and use it multiple times daily.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Mccafferty

customer_reviews.title: You need to carry this with you everywhere
customer_reviews.text: I personally have 2 of there and take them everywhere. Bought this one as a gift and the recipient said it's come in handy so many times. Should be part of everyone's everyday carry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: Lost my previous skeletool and just had to get another one. It seriously stands the test of time and does whatever you need of it (within reason). Wanted a bit of flair and went with the blue. Part of my EDC and I never leave home without it. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Think of it as pliers and a knife. The rest is meh...
customer_reviews.text: I like the look of this leatherman, and the functions it has work. It's light, solid, and tools like this have served me in the field more times than I should have needed them. That said, this doesn't have the same hefty feel that my old leatherman had and it has almost no accessories. On the one hand, that's fine with me. All I really wanted was a pliers and knife that could fit in my pocket. The carabiner/bottle opener is actually fantastically handy as a way to keep track of/carry this around. The screwdriver is... Well, it's an emergency tool. It would have to be pretty bad before this was something I would want to use as a screwdriver.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua-1

customer_reviews.title: Compact, hangs on belt loop. Flathead drivers falls out easily.
customer_reviews.text: I love this model tool. The green is vibrant and easy to see in the dark if dropped etc. I just wish they included extra flathead drivers, it's so easy for them to fall out.
customer_reviews.author: Brian R.O Dickson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what i wanted. Can't go wrong with Leatherman, they're the original. This one I got so I can carry at work on nights that I work security. Its great having the essentials, the knife folds out from the top without having to open the whole tool and is very effective. The bit driver, bottle opener, pliers and wire cutters I've all used in the first four days of having it. Its light and easy to carry compared to so many other larger heavy ones, which of course I still recommend, but those will be staying in the glove box or tool box for the foreseeable future. This is my new go to carry multi-tool.
customer_reviews.author: kingpin

customer_reviews.title: Blade broke in less than a week
customer_reviews.text: My fiance LOVES his skeletool... until his blade broke in less than a wk & I'm having a hard time finding replacement blades. Leatherman is supposed to be high quality & would have gotten 5 stars (bc my fiance uses it daily) but I'm not happy about the blade...which is pretty much the point of this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great multi-tool.... Leatherman has a real winner.
customer_reviews.text: Love this tool. I have made it my EDC. It does everything I need it to do. I had an older Leatherman and liked it but I had to keep it in a sheath and the pliers handle kind of cut into my hand. No problem with this one. The Skeletool has a pocket clip and fit easily in my pocket. The knife locks up good and can be deployed without opening the knife. My older Leatherman had to be opened up to deploy the knife. The pliers were a little stiff, but have begun to loosen up. There are even other bit options sold to make it more versatile. Love this multi-tool.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Bit holder needs adjustment to work
customer_reviews.text: The tool itself is exactly what I needed. It has the things I need and use daily without the extra bulk of tools I would rarely, if ever, use. Four stars is only because of the misinformation. The color as labeled Leatherman is Sublime green, not moss. And the detaiks state that a spare bit would come with it. Unfortunately I only recieved a double sided phillips bit, no flat head or t-bit to speak of. The bit holder works great once you get a seperate set of pliers and tighten it, otherwise bits just fall out.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Ballows

customer_reviews.title: 5 oz multi tool. Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect light duty multi tool. Great tool that I carry everyday. It's light and has just what you need for most situations. I have a few other multi tools but do not carry them due to the weight, so I leave them in my vehicle. The best feature is the knife that can be deployed from the tools closed postion. I gave had one of these for years. Lifetime warranty is great and never had an issue replacing a broken tool (usually from user abuse). Now my fiance carries one everyday too. She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Winne

customer_reviews.title: Snapped when putting pressure on jammed plastic piece of a computer chair.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't expect it to break the way it did at this price point. Very disappointed in the product. No real force was being exerted on the tool at the time, just trying to un jam a small piece of plastic and the metal tool broke haha.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 21st century pocket knife! Made in America
customer_reviews.text: MADE IN AMERICA!!! It's the little multi tool that could. No bigger than a pocket knife and about the same weight. Just enough features to keep you from running to the tool box. It's got knife blade with serrations, screwdrivers,pliers with nippers and a bottle opener. It has a pocket clip and a belt loop clip. And that's right...its made in the good ole U.S of A !
customer_reviews.author: Mr XTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Very Versatile and Useful Item.  The Cost price is cheap compared to what they actually cost.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for one of my employee's birthday. I had one previously for over a year and I love this product. This unit is so useful at which I carry this in my pocket everywhere. It is also very durable and will not break or get damaged for even tough uses. My employee use to use mine quite often on jobs to the point where I knew he would carry and use this. I highly recommend this product. I had purchased my original Leatherman with the carbon fiber accents which cost me around $100. This was a great buy. I am thinking about getting another one...they are so well built and useful. Highly Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Sulkes

product_meta.title: LEATHERMAN, Skeletool Lightweight Multitool with Combo Knife and Bottle Opener, Stainless Steel
feature_bullets: EVERYTHING YOU NEED: A compact 5-ounce multitool with a combo knife, bit driver, pliers and more; Light enough to use as your everyday carry, strong enough to tackle tough jobs
7 TOOLS IN 1: Includes a knife, pliers, a large exchangeable bit driver, wire-cutters and a carabiner/bottle opener; Includes an extra bit stored right in the handle

OUR GUARANTEE: We’re proud to stand behind every product that leaves our factory in Portland, Oregon; That’s why we offer our 25-year warranty, so you can be confident your Leatherman lasts a lifetime
ONE-HAND ACCESS. Skeletool only requires one hand to open and use all the tools, even the ones that aren't accessible from the outside; And with a locking blade, you can cut with confidence
ALWAYS ON HAND: The Skeletool weighs just 5 ounces and is equipped with a removable pocket clip so it's always within reach and ready to work

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars2,465 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
